name: places/ChIJ8-vLwJRZwokROdUz9oZ_pWc
formattedAddress: 99 Charles St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 99 Charles St, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text: The customer service at this garage has fallen to incredibly low levels.  I was a customer for several years and recently left because it became impossible to collect my vehicle: the phone frequently wasn’t answered; there were consistent delays; and on many evenings I had to wait to get in the garage.  Some times I felt bad for the employees because they would only have one person working after 6 PM.  Other times, the employees were outright rude and hostile, particularly to my wife.   It’s a real shame, but I would definitely not recommend

originalText.text:
This is the second time I’ve parked in this garage.
The first time, the worker told me I needed to pay $5 because I entered the garage 5 minutes before my reservation. Even though I got the car hours before my reservation was over.
The second time he charged a $15 fee, and kept saying that it was the system not him but wouldn’t explain why he was charging me. The worker on Friday nights is very rude.
Reviews are true. This is a scam

Reviews are true. This is a scam

originalText.text:
Scam! Avoid at all costs!

We went to bestparking.com and got a coupon to park for $28 today. We parked our car there and when we returned less than two hours later and our bill was $66!!

We could not retrieve our car until the bill was paid. It’s a total sham, scam, thieves. The guy would not accept bestparking although it’s listed with BestParking. Plus our car is the small 2010 Subaru outback, NOT oversized car, we were charged an extra $15 for being oversized. It was a terrible shock on a lovely Sunday.

Don’t go there! It’s a complete scam!

originalText.text: Every negative review you read is 100% accurate.  Avoid this garage at all costs as it operates to rip customers off.  My wife and I used an app to book a spot for a few hours.  The cost was $20 and our reservation was supposed to be from 12:30pm to 6:30 pm (the $20 technically covered up to midnight).  Upon coming back to the garage to get our car we were told we had to pay an additional $26 dollars because we dropped our car off at 12:21pm and not 12:30pm.  We tried to explain we paid on the app and were not told of this before dropping off our car.  When we refused to pay extra one of employees took my wife's phone as well as our car keys and refused to return them.  Because of this we had to ask a police office to assist us and after explaining the situation to the office he was very concerned at this practice and asked the attendants to return our keys so we could leave.  Thank you to the NYPD Office that helped us as he was incredibly professional and we fully recognize he has better things to do.  That said we will NEVER use another parking garage in NYC again and will take our chances with street parking.

originalText.text:
I wish I couldn’t leave negative stars.
This was a horrific experience. This is the second time I’ve had a terrible experience with your app and I refuse to ever use it again. My husband and I dropped off our car today at 12:21 PM our reservation was for 12:30 PM until 7:30 PM., which we prepaid on the SpotHero app. When we went to pick up our car around 6:30 PM we were told we could not pick it up because we dropped it off early. The people at the garage refused to give us our keys and held my phone hostage. When we arrived at 12:21 PM we showed them the reservation that we booked and paid for on SpotHero. Of course at that time, there were no issues with the reservation and they happily took our car and keys and parked our car. They asked us when we would be back and we said between 6:30 PM and 7:30 PM. Everything was OK. Once we came to pick up the car we realized that there was a massive problem. They kept harping on the fact that we dropped off the car at nine minutes early and there was some issue with the ticket, and we had to pay an extra $26 to get our car out of the garage. Why is this? If the price is going to be $46 why didn’t your app say that? Why didn’t your app say that why could not drop your car off early? Thankfully an NYPD officer was walking by the garage as I was on the phone with 911 because we could not get our car keys. The officer was even in disbelief that we couldn’t get our car keys back and that it was a massive problem that we dropped the car off nine minutes early. He had to tell the garage attendance to give our keys back to us since he could see we paid for parking on the app.
This is obscenely disturbing and I hope no one ever has to go through this experience.
